Don't forget that this weekend we have some amazing activities and exhibits. Including @MakerFaireSYD! #ssf15
Dr Silburn has finished up at the @maasmuseum tonight! #ssf15
KS: I try to teach students not to argue with someone who is so obviously science illiterate  because they bring the argument down #ssf15
KS: These days we don't expect every student to want to be a scientist but we DO expect them to be science literate #ssf15
Question: "What do your students think about the culture of anti-science these days?" #ssf15
After a feud  Tesla left Edison  worked for Westinghouse  then did some solo work #ssf15
KS: Tesla's work and ideas were so new and revolutionary that it was difficult to believe he was human #ssf15
Someone has asked for some info on Tesla in comparison to Edison (Yaassss) #ssf15
Dr Ken Silburn is done with his great and all encompassing chat tonight! Question time. #ssf15
KS: "If you don't believe in climate change or global warming  there's something wrong with you. Or you may be a politician" #ssf15
Some purely  sage advice here from @KenSilburn #ssf15 http://t.co/CjjwW1FfzJ
KS is discussing the different ways people can reject peer-reviewed #opensciecne. Eg anti-vaxxers  qualms with polio vaccine etc #ssf15
Humans just tense the whole time (self awareness  fear  etc). So don't try this at home plz #ssf15
KS: This is why they are injured more on the shorter falls than longer ones. Relaxing the body prevents (some) injury #ssf15
KS: Cats tend to tense up in the first few seconds of falling but then relax after a while of free falling #ssf15
Onto a (kind of) nicer topic  'why do cats jump out windows and generally are fine?". Lots of pretty great cat pics on screen rn #ssf15
There was once an elephant who was charged for murder and no one knew how to do the execution  so... #ssf15
Westinghouse refused to contribute to the electric chair  whereas Edison championed for his (KS: "Edison was a pig of a man") #ssf15
Moving onto the Edison vs. Westinghouse debate  one of the key motivations of electricity was better execution methods... #ssf15
KS: "Never fly a kite in a thunder storm. Best places to get hit by lightning are golf courses and the beach" #ssf15
"Do we have any volunteers to be electrocuted?"  @KenSilburn asks while 'The Imperial March' plays ominously in the background #ssf15
.@KenSilburn is soaring through so many scientific topics tonight; already covered memory  balance and electricity! #ssf15
The @GSAForum is holding a talk called 'Powering Sydney into the Future" for #ssf15. Buy tickets here! https://t.co/QXVc9eID7a
.@KenSilburn is explaining how when Einstein was working  science attracted an almost rockstar status #ssf15
KS gives us a quick little intro on Einstein  who actually wanted to be a teacher #ssf15
Unveiling of 2015 David Malin Awards - Winning Sky Photos @sydneyobs tonight! 🌌👌🏼 @SydScienceFest @maasmuseum #ssf15 http://t.co/5H5X2XpDVl
KS: "I'm going to speak tonight about the history of science but also how things have changed" #ssf15
KS admits he spoke with some school kids today and practiced his jokes on them  so they are refined for us #ssf15
And we're getting started  with a packed house for @KenSilburn! #ssf15 http://t.co/DehqcQ2VTj
Playing some casual tunes before the crowds roll in #ssf15 http://t.co/camffAprhf
Doors are opening for Dr Ken Silburn tonight at @maasmuseum #ssf15

RT @SCBar_PMAP: RT @SCBAR: Come learn about technology in the law office at #LPMTECH  9/18. Register today to save $50. http://t.co/5JxE8er…
Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock is done for her talk now. But check out our other events coming up. We are only getting started! #ssf15 #natsciwk
Small boy: The News said that a galaxy is going to crash into us  MP: Yes  yes that's right  there is  unfortunately  #ssf15
(On a Big Bang question)MP: The name Big Bang was an insult used to discredit the theory. Similar to 'The God Particle' #ssf15
MP: So you can detect them by watching the movements of nearby stars #ssf15
MP: Detecting black holes are tricky because they don't emit light but stars move around them #ssf15
Next Q: "What evidence do we have that a black hole is at the centre of our galaxy?" #ssf15
First question from young girl: what do you think aliens would look like  MP: I've prepared an image actually #ssf15 http://t.co/orWBw8lunQ
Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock is wrapping up her talk now with some questions #ssf15
MP: What if aliens saw Earth with dinosaurs and just thought "lets get out of here" #ssf15
MP: So many factors against us potentially meeting other life in space. #ssf15
MP: The evolution of scientific ideas coupled with seeing how the cost of any kind of travel eventually drops supports space travel #ssf15
Reminder this is on tomorrow!! #ssf15 https://t.co/J3ZtcZfTCV
MP: One of the best things about space travel (now) is that you are all from Earth. You just have to work together. Eg. @ISS_Research #ssf15
The cost of getting 1.5 kgs into space costs somewhere between $70-100k. That's the cost for only 1.5L of water! #ssf15
MP: who here would make a one-way trip to Mars?  *about two hands go up"  MP: That's INCREDIBLE #ssf15
The school kids in the audience seem very  very keen on this idea. #ssf15
Also  the whole eviction thing... But MP solves this problem by saying the winners get to go home. Losers stay in space. #ssf15
Biggest problem for space travel is cost. So  the Big Brother Space Travel idea solves that with reality TV funding.  Seriously.  #ssf15
MP has a plan to get herself into space. This plan is basically...  Big Brother meets interplanetary travel! #ssf15
We are now learning about the ridiculous processes involved in having to go to the toilet in space (spoiler: locked doors and straps) #ssf15
RT @SydScienceFest: (The bottom photo is of MP and her husband - both scientists) #ssf15
RT @SydScienceFest: MP shows her students this photo and asks spot the scientist. And people go for the white  men #ssf15 http://t.co/FWL2Z…
(The bottom photo is of MP and her husband - both scientists) #ssf15
MP: it's important for kids to see that you don't need to be a boy  white or exceptionally serious to be a scientist #ssf15
MP shows her students this photo and asks spot the scientist. And people go for the white  men #ssf15 http://t.co/FWL2ZSNoBY
MP: When people think of scientists  they usually think of someone white  male and very very serious #ssf15
MP says Dyslexia impacted her education a lot. Asks "are there any dyslexics in the house?" *few arms* MP: "Yaassss" #ssf15
Great to see so many school groups and kids enthusiastic about space and astronomy at the @maasmuseum today #ssf15
Starts by asking "if space travel was as safe/affordable as flight travel  who would go into space?"  *whole room raises both arms*  #ssf15
Incredibly packed theatre for MP #ssf15 http://t.co/b64DNE2nEi
Getting ready for another chat with Dr Aderin-Pocock! #ssf15 http://t.co/JOFK73cGkp
Here's a @auscicomm write-up of our festival so far and what's to come  from @jackie_randles http://t.co/KFH6t0SO3o #ssf15

RT @SydScienceFest: A massive shout-out to @Intelanz and @JaycarAU for helping to make @MakerFaireSYD happen #ssf15 (also Chip the robot) h…
RT @SydScienceFest: Don't forget that we have another week of #ssf15!  Tomorrow night we have a @DoctorKarl talk  a @Sydney_Ideas lecture A…
Don't forget that we have another week of #ssf15!  Tomorrow night we have a @DoctorKarl talk  a @Sydney_Ideas lecture AND a @GSAForum panel
The end of an amazing talk by @swfoto tonight. Wrapping up with some questions... #ssf15
Video onscreen of using a robot with a camera on it to take photos of Tigers. #ssf15
SW: The alarm call for a tiger is a spotted deer squeak. You hear that  there's a tiger nearby. #ssf15
SW: ecotourism  next gen education  working with local communities - all things that help stop this hunting #ssf15
SW: People use rhino horn for supposed medicinal value. It's made of keratin. You're better off chewing your nails #ssf15
SW: The protection of rhinos is the only one in India that has a shoot to kill policy #ssf15
Moving onto rhinos now #ssf15
"Finally  I moved onto the tiger. They are very endangered  hard to find and highly revered " #ssf15
This is it #ssf15 http://t.co/eHQmYrbI06
SW: After 15 months  I finally got a shot of one in front of the Hollywood sign #ssf15
SW: I got a picture of a cougar. A bobcat. A deer. A raccoon. A guy walking his dog. Some hikers. But no mountain lion. #ssf15
SW: I really wanted to get a photo of a mountain lion on front of the Hollywood sign. Just because. #ssf15
SW: Unfortunately  people hunt mountain lions because they aren't  endangered. #ssf15
SW: My first photo was of a half a field mice. But a year later  we got some of cougars #ssf15
SW: Even though these cats were tagged to study them in relation to wolf packs  I still had a lot of trouble photographing them #ssf15
SW: In all this time  I had never worked in the US  so I started looking at cougars #ssf15
SW: I was told you would never get a photo of a cat during the day. Well  cats do whatever you don't want them to do. So I got one. #ssf15
"Zen and the Art of Photo Capture" #ssf15
SW: You know how you go through your phone photos and there are heaps of your face by accident? That's all we had during that trip #ssf15
"Then we had to load that on horseback and walk up the mountains" #ssf15
"I brought 33 bags with me on the trip to photograph the snow leopard"   For those wondering it looked like maybe 15 airport trolleys #ssf15
SW then decided to pick the next  most difficult big cat to find - SNOW LEOPARDS. #ssf15
"First time I did it  a jaguar called back  I got scared and drove away" #ssf15
Apparently you can stick your head in a bucket and make a weird noise to call a jaguar #ssf15
SW: Cats are curious animals  they want to know who is in their territory #ssf15
Naturally  Steve Winter took it on #ssf15
Apparently in all the decades @NatGeo was in print  they had never done anything on the 3rd biggest cat in the world. It was too hard #ssf15
One of his mates told him the next day "oh don't worry  that was just a black jaguar".   "And that's how Big Cats chose me..." #ssf15
Then one night  he heard the floorboards creaking  the stairs creaking and sniffing at his head. #ssf15
When SW was just getting started with being the jungle  he couldn't figure out why for the first few nights he felt uneasy... #ssf15
SW: Im going to take you on a trip with these four cats; Jaguars  Snow Leopards  Cougars and Tigers #ssf15
*photo of a rhino* "This wasn't supposed to be a rhino  we wanted a leopard  but oh well" #ssf15
SW: I love visiting S.Africa  its so beautiful and easy to work with. You're guaranteed to find the Big 5 #ssf15
Spotted a drone! #ssf15
.@swfoto is starting off his talk with some incredible footage of BIG CATS. They really are just quite big. #ssf15
SW: "Ive been on the road since May. India to South Africa to India to Sri Lanka to here" #ssf15

RT @SydScienceFest: Biohack Talk: "Academia is usually a bit down on us  but that's changing .. now there's Uni run biohack groups" #ssf15
Biohack Talk: "Academia is usually a bit down on us  but that's changing .. now there's Uni run biohack groups" #ssf15
